com.f2prateek.progressbutton
Class ProgressButton

java.lang.Object
  android.view.View
      android.widget.TextView
          android.widget.Button
              android.widget.CompoundButton
                  com.f2prateek.progressbutton.ProgressButton
All Implemented Interfaces:
android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.ViewTreeObserver.OnPreDrawListener, android.widget.Checkable
public class ProgressButton
extends android.widget.CompoundButton

A two-state button that indicates whether some related content is pinned (the checked state) or unpinned (the unchecked state), and the download progress for this content.

See Android Design: Progress & Activity for more details on this custom indicator.

The example on the website is also the default visual implementation that is provided. By default the button is not clickable (by the user). If you want the user to be able to control the state, use View.setClickable(boolean).

See Also:
View.setClickable(boolean), View.setFocusable(boolean)
